Crimes.Crime_Name: Cessation of refugee protection under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of RPD's decision to cease refugee protection
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 108(1)(a)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants returned to Mexico with Mexican passports, obtained new ones, and traveled back to Canada
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: RPD's decision to cease protection upheld
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Voluntary return to country of origin and use of national passports
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Presumption of reavailment based on passport use and travel
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants’ explanations failed to rebut presumption
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Use of Mexican passports, travel records, timing of return
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 108(1)(a) IRPA allows cessation upon voluntary reavailment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to rebut presumption of reavailment
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Loss of refugee status and associated protections
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants voluntarily returned to Mexico and used Mexican passports
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Sufficiency of explanation to counter passport use
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliance with conditions of protected status
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over RPD decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Travel and passport use indicate intent to reavail
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Conduct inconsistent with continued fear of persecution
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of compelling evidence to rebut presumption

Crimes.Crime_Name: Voluntary reavailment of protection under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration status and cessation of refugee protection
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether applicants voluntarily reavailed themselves of Mexico's protection
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 108(1)(a)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Use of Mexican passports and return to Mexico in 2006
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Cessation upheld for mother; insufficient analysis for minor child
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to rebut presumption of reavailment
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicants' explanations not sufficient to rebut conduct
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Voluntary reavailment leads to cessation under IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of RPD's analysis regarding minor child
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Returning to home country and using national documents
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Partial success: upheld for adult, questionable for child
Crimes.Judicial_Review_Outcome: Application dismissed, but noted deficiency for child
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Travel to Mexico, use and renewal of Mexican passports
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA framework on cessation of refugee protection
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Explanations provided but not accepted by RPD
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Protected persons whose status was ceased
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Voluntary reavailment of home country protection
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Dismissed with partial concern for child
